abstract: Automakers scrambled to determine whether they would be able to build and export cars in light of the rolling power blackouts and the damage to Japan’s infrastructure.
snippet: Automakers scrambled to determine whether they would be able to build and export cars in light of the rolling power blackouts and the damage to Japan’s infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: Most Japanese auto assembly plants will remain closed on Monday, even though the factories are outside the hardest-hit regions and did not experience significant damage from the devastating earthquake and tsunami that struck on Friday.

headline.main: Auto Plants in Japan Remain Closed as Companies Take Stock
headline.print_headline: Auto Plants in Japan Remain Closed as Companies Take Stock
